Keeping that pair intact makes the game harder for everyone else to navigate. I've shown my willingness to connect outside established lines, seeking collaboration this round, particularly with P8. Breaking up the P1/P3 pair is the logical step to open up the game dynamics. Eliminating one of them allows for more fluid strategy moving forward and prevents that solid bloc from dominating. Please consider this strategic imperative.
